title: The Model
subtitle: Why Integrated Redevelopment Wins
description: Fragmented redevelopment fails. The Banor integrated solution closes the loop between workforce, property, and capital.
intro: Traditional redevelopment fragments workforce programs, property rehab, and capital deployment. Banor integrates all three into a single, closed-loop ecosystem.

sections.title: Why Fragmented Redevelopment Fails
sections.content: When workforce training operates in isolation, graduates struggle to find jobs. When development happens without a local labor pipeline, projects import workers. When capital flows without mission alignment, impact dissipates. Fragmentation is the enemy of scale.

sections.title: The Banor Integrated Solution
sections.content: Banor closes the loop. Foundation builds the workforce. Development deploys that workforce. Capital funds the projects. Projects generate reinvestmentâ€”back into Foundation and Development. One mission. Three engines. Full circle.

steps.title: Foundation Builds Workforce
steps.description: Certifies youth in construction trades. Graduates enter Development employment pathway.

steps.title: Development Deploys Workforce
steps.description: Acquires vacant properties, rehabilitates with local labor, and stabilizes neighborhoods.

steps.title: Capital Funds Projects
steps.description: Impact investors fund Development projects and Foundation programs.

steps.title: Projects Generate Reinvestment
steps.description: Returns flow back into Foundation and new Development projects. The cycle continues.

items.title: Blended Capital
items.description: Philanthropic, impact, and market-rate capital work together. Each layer de-risks the next.

items.title: Risk Mitigation
items.description: Workforce pipeline reduces labor risk. Development expertise reduces execution risk.

items.title: Scale
items.description: Proven model replicates across cities. Capital follows documented impact.
